title: Blubber
subtitle: A docker-compose.yml builder for wikibase-docker
prolog_description:
Blubber is a tool that will help you setup a wikibase based on Docker quickly and easily.

Docker is a program that performs a type of virtualisation called containerization. You can get more information here.

If you want to setup docker now you can use this link.

You will also need docker-compose, which is included in Docker CE (community edition). If you find it is missing you can follow the installation guide here.
components_question:
Mediawiki with Wikibase and MariaDb(an SQL server) will automatically be included.

Which additional components do you want to include?
components_elasticsearch_help: Elasticsearch is a more advanced search, which can be used for faster and more accurate search in your Wikibase. See here for more
components_wikibaseQuickstatements_help: QuickStatements is a tool that can automatically create and update Wikibase items or statements. See here for more
components_wikibaseQueryService_help: The Wikibase Query Service allows SPARQL based queries to be run on your data. See here for more
portsConfigurationDescription: Ports allow for communication between several applications on a single host. A port is identified by a non negative number, which is unique. Also there are so called "well known ports", which are addessed by numbers in the range from 0 to 1023, so you can't use ports in this range.
wikibaseBlazegraphPort: Which port should Blazegraph of the Wikibase query service use?
wikibaseProxyPort: Which port should the proxy of the Wikibase query service use?
wikibaseFrontendPort: Which port should the user interface of Wikibase query service use?
quickStatementsConfigurationNamespacePro: Which namespace you want to use for properties in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationNamespaceIte: Which namespace you want to use for items in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationPrefixProper: Which prefix you want to use for properties in Wikibase?
quickStatementsConfigurationPrefixItem: Which prefix you want to use for items in Wikibase?
mediawikiSiteName: What would you like your site to be called?
mediawikiAdminName: What would you like the username of your admin account to be?
mediawikiAdminPassword: What would you like the password of your admin account to be?
databasePort: Which port should the database use?
databaseName: What should your database be called?
databaseUser: What should the name of your database user be?
databaseUserPassword: What should the database user password be?
finish_description:
You can download your docker-compose.yml file using the button to the right.

You can now run your Wikibase docker-compose environment.

To learn how to do this, refer to the manual
